items.title: Bootstrap 5 is here, drops jQuery
items.content:
Frontend Focus

#‚Äã490 ‚Äî May 12, 2021 | Read on the web

Bootstrap 5 Released ‚Äî This is a big release for the ever popular CSS framework with plenty of notable changes, including new components, updated forms, RTL support, and the removal of jQuery.

Mark Otto

Can I Email..? Support Tables for HTML and CSS in Emails ‚Äî It‚Äôs like Can I Use but for email clients and their varying levels of HTML and CSS support. We first linked this about 18 months ago but it‚Äôs had a bunch of updates¬†recently.

HTeuMeuLeu

Modern Dropdowns in Angular Made Easy - A Quick Tutorial ‚Äî While a vanilla dropdown is a simple HTML element, more advanced features can get tricky. In 13 minutes, you will learn how to bind data, implement autocomplete, and more using Kendo UI for Angular. No purchase required, so give it a¬†try.

Kendo UI for Angular sponsor

A Primer on CSS Container Queries ‚Äî A prototype of the long-awaited CSS container queries has now landed in Chrome Canary and is available for experimentation. Stephanie Eckles looks at how container queries work, and how they compare with and complement existing CSS features for¬†layout.

Smashing Magazine

Next Gen CSS: @container ‚Äî As above, Una takes a look at what this CSS Working Group Containment Level 3 spec property hopes to bring to the table: styling elements based on the size of their parent¬†container. Some demos worth checking out here.

Una Kravets

‚ö°Ô∏è Quick bits:

  • Here are the release notes for Safari Technology Preview 124.
  • Chrome just added support for yet another ‚Äúcustom‚Äù feature: custom state pseudo-classes. ≈†ime Vidas takes a look.
  • In addition to Bootstrap 5 dropping (see above), we've also got a new release of the accompanying icon set. It adds 45 new icons.
  • CSS Hell is a collection of common CSS mistakes, and how to fix them.

üìô Tutorials, Articles & Opinion

Optimizing Web Vitals using Lighthouse ‚Äî Looks at new tooling features in Google‚Äôs Lighthouse, PageSpeed and DevTools that can help identify how your site can improve on the Web¬†Vitals.

Addy Osmani

How Web Components are Used at GitHub ‚Äî GitHub has long been a proponent of Web Components with over 17 open-source components available for all to use. Here‚Äôs their story of why they use them and how they build¬†them.

Kristj√°n Oddsson

Counting Faces with OpenCV, Python and InfluxDB ‚Äî A step-by-step guide on building a crowd control app powered with time series data. Project code available for¬†use.

InfluxData sponsor

Web Accessibility for Newbies ‚Äî Introductory information and advice on how to think about and approach web¬†accessibility.

Karina Chow beginner

What I Learned by Relearning HTML ‚Äî Thoughts on how going back to the basics can help discover ‚Äòunknown¬†unknowns‚Äô.

Danny Guo

Practical Use Cases For CSS Variables ‚Äî Walks you through use-cases where CSS variables¬†shine.

Ahmad Shadeed

How to Use the Vibration API on Your Site
Bibek Kakati

Auditing Design Systems for Accessibility
Anna E. Cook

Criticism Pushes The Web Forward
Hidde de Vries

How We Sped Up Chrome DevTools Stack Traces by 10x
Chrome Developers

üîß Code, Tools and Resources

Using 'Computer Modern' on the Web ‚Äî If you‚Äôve ever read or even written an academic paper, you may have encountered the TeX typesetting system and its distinctive associated fonts. Here they‚Äôve been packaged up in a form that you can easily use them on the¬†Web.

Christian Perfect

Bootstarters: A Free Set of Bootstrap 5 Templates ‚Äî As mentioned above, Bootstrap 5 is out now, as such here are some MIT-licensed templates. There's about 18 templates here, styled in accordance with Material Design 2.0 guidelines and built with the latest version of¬†Bootstrap.

mdb

Need Developers? Revelo Helps You Hire Pre-Vetted Remote¬†Devs

Revelo sponsor

Hammer: An esbuild-Powered Build Tool for HTML Applications ‚Äî The idea is to a TypeScript-centric ‚Äúultra lightweight alternative to¬†Parcel.‚Äù

Haydn Paterson

Awesome Landing Page: A Collection of Beautiful and Practical Landing Page Templates

Nordic Giant

items.title: The history of CSS
items.content:
Frontend Focus

#‚Äã489 ‚Äî May 5, 2021 | Read on the web

The History of CSS ‚Äî Jay Hoffman returns for another instalment in his excellent web history series, this time looking at the backstory of CSS. The series so far has covered things such as search, browsers, web design, and more ‚Äî¬†all are well worth a read. Oh, and there‚Äôs also an audio version of this narrated by Jeremy Keith if you¬†fancy.

CSS-Tricks

The Humble <img> Element and Core Web Vitals ‚Äî Images have always been a key part of the web (well, since HTML 2.0 anyway ;-) ‚Äî they communicate ideas instantly, but they are also a lot heavier than text to load. As such, it‚Äôs essential to get loading and displaying them right. Here's an excerpt from Addy‚Äôs new book on the topic (also, check a free PDF¬†preview).

Addy Osmani

Nail the Fundamentals of Web Performance ‚Äî Join Todd Gardner for an in-depth course on all things web perf. You‚Äôll learn about new core web vitals metrics, such as cumulative layout shift, and how to improve¬†them.

Frontend Masters sponsor

New WebKit Features in Safari 14.1 ‚Äî We mentioned this release in passing in last week‚Äôs issue, but here‚Äôs a blog post from the WebKit team outlining what‚Äôs new ‚Äî¬†such as Flexbox Gap support, individual CSS transform properties, the Paint Timing API, WebM support, and¬†more.

Jon Davis

‚ö°Ô∏è Quick bits:

  • Microsoft have joined the Bytecode Alliance to 'advance' WebAssembly.
  • Frontend Practice is a site that challenges you to recreate real websites as way to hone your frontend skills.
  • Throwback: Remember the CSS Zen Garden? It's now 18 years old.

üìô Tutorials, Articles & Opinion

How to Create Actions for Selected Text With the Selection API ‚Äî Click, drag, release: you‚Äôve just selected some text on a webpage‚Äâ‚Äî‚Äâa selection menu pops up with some options for what you may want to do next. Here‚Äôs how to make¬†one.

Preethi Sam

Performance-Testing the Google I/O Site ‚Äî Another solid performance review from Jake here, this time looking at how the Google I/O site fares on a 3G mobile connection. (Spoiler: It‚Äôs rather¬†slow)

Jake Archibald

The State of CSS Cross-Browser Development ‚Äî Thoughts on why cross-browser development is better today than ever before, and a look at what issues still¬†remain.

Ahmad Shadeed

Trouble with Remote Pair Programming? Download Revelo‚Äôs eBook ‚Äî The future of work is here. Prepare yourself and your team for remote¬†pairing.

Revelo sponsor

Understanding Design Systems: Designing Component APIs ‚Äî ‚ÄúDesigners that understand how component APIs work can make more meaningful decisions when defining a¬†component‚Äù

Eduardo Ferreira

Don't You Forget About Me: Overlooked Breakpoints in Responsive Design
Polypane

Top Metrics You Need to Understand When Measuring Frontend Performance
Fernando Doglio

Variable Fonts in WordPress: How to Use Them and Why
Karol K

The Evolution of Jamstack
Mathias Biilmann

üîß Code, Tools and Resources

Iconic: A Free Set of 'Do-what-you-want' Pixel-Perfect Icons ‚Äî 150+ SVG icons. Requires login to download or copy the code and the icons are searchable and¬†categorized.

James M & Orman C

CQFill: A Polyfill for CSS Container Queries ‚Äî In case you were wondering, Container Queries have no browser support yet except Chrome behind a flag. Related: Bramus Van Damme takes a look at how it works¬†here.

jonathan neal

A Better Way to Build Internal Tools

Retool sponsor

CSS Filters Generator: A Live Playground for CSS Filters ‚Äî This online tool lets you easily generate cross-browser CSS to modify hue, saturation, brightness, contrast, etc. using CSS filters. Upload your own image or use the¬†example.

Michael Bollin

Eva.js: A Frontend Game Engine for Creating Interactive Game Projects ‚Äî Includes components that are ready to use out-of-the-box and it uses PixiJS for performant WebGL rendering. Try it in this live¬†playground.

EVA

QuickSnippets: Categorized Code Snippets Sourced from Tweets ‚Äî Nicely laid out, searchable, and categorized for easy filtering. Note that the snippets are generally in images, so not the most accessible, but it‚Äôs a nice¬†selection.

QuickSnippets

Font Subsetter: A Fast and Easy to Use Font Subset Generator

orthosie

Jobs

Senior Software Engineer, Frontend (Remote) ‚Äî Access thousands of remote frontend jobs from 13k+ top global companies, hiring now. Visit Arc today.
Arc.dev

items.title: Here's how to use those new CSS pseudo-class selectors
items.content:
Frontend Focus

#‚Äã488 ‚Äî April 28, 2021 | Read on the web

A Guide To Newly Supported, Modern CSS Pseudo-Class Selectors ‚Äî The CSS Working Group Editor‚Äôs Draft for Selectors Level 4 includes several pseudo-class selectors that already have proposal candidates in most modern browsers. This guide will cover ones that currently have the best support along with examples to demonstrate how you can start using them¬†today.

Stephanie Eckles

Learn How to Structure Your Remote Hiring Process ‚Äî A new era of remote work suddenly arrived and managers need to enhance their recruiting process if they want to win the best talent for their companies. This guide shows you how GitLab, Zapier and other companies build thriving remote¬†teams.

Revelo sponsor

Getting Started with CSS Custom Properties ‚Äî Andy looks at just how useful Custom properties in CSS can be, ‚Äúnot just for tokenising your CSS, but also for abstracting complexity and interactivity into smaller, easier to manage pieces‚Äù. This short guide will get you up to speed with how they work and how to use¬†them.

Andy Bell

‚ö°Ô∏è Quick bits:

  • The CSS Working Group has maintained a list of CSS mistakes that "should be corrected if anyone invents a time machine".
  • Here's another new 'browser' to put on your radar: Mighty. It's currently in early access and streams a cloud-hosted browser to your own¬†machine.
  • In last week's issue we featured a round-up of links looking at Google's FLoC proposal ‚Äî now GitHub is the latest to block FLoC across all GitHub Pages.
  • Safari 14.1 shipped this week, with support for Flexbox Gap, however you still need to provide a fallback, so here's Ahmad Shadeed with how to detect support.

üìô Tutorials, Articles & Opinion

Generating and Solving Sudokus in CSS ‚Äî ‚ÄúI love to make CSS do stuff it shouldn‚Äôt‚Äù. This is a fun look at just how to approach tackling such an¬†experiment.

Lee Meyer

How to Bake Layers of Accessibility Testing Into Your Process ‚Äî Accessibility experts Kate Kalcevich and Mike Gifford introduce ‚Äúlayered accessibility testing‚Äù, a practice of using a variety of tools/approaches at different stages in a product lifecycle to catch accessibility issues early (when it‚Äôs easier and cheaper to fix¬†them).

Smashing Magazine

The Complete Guide to Google's Core Web Vitals Performance Metrics ‚Äî A solid overview of all the key terms of Google‚Äôs performance metrics. We featured a handy guide along similar lines in last week‚Äôs¬†issue.

Craig Buckler

A Webpack Tutorial for Beginners: A Step-by-Step Guide ‚Äî If you‚Äôve tried other bundler options but haven‚Äôt looked into webpack (maybe because of the bigger learning curve), this introductory tutorial might be a good starting¬†point.

Louis Lazaris beginner

[Guide] The Truth About Developer Productivity Metrics ‚Äî What you need to know to avoid weaponizing metrics for performance reviews, and use them to accelerate releases¬†instead.

Sleuth sponsor

Customizing Tailwind CSS ‚Äî A look at how to make Tailwind look different whilst ‚Äúkeeping all the underlying¬†goodies‚Äù.

Ben Mann

How to Test Website Speed the Right Way ‚Äî A step-by-step tutorial on how to properly run tests to ensure optimum page load times and¬†performance.

John Demian

The Making (and Potential Benefits) of a CSS Font ‚Äî A way to render text without using any font at¬†all.

Levi Szekeres

Live Webinar: Building Editor X‚Äôs Award-Winning Homepage

Editor X sponsor

How to Style and Define The Color of Radio and Checkbox Inputs
Stefan Judis

‚ñ∂¬†¬†Build and Deploy a Responsive Gallery Portfolio using HTML and CSS
Ania Kub√≥w

A Web Developer's Guide to AVIF Images
Darek Kay

üîß Code, Tools and Resources

Lighthouse Metrics: Global Performance Insights for Your Site ‚Äî Enter a URL and this tool will give you Lighthouse scores based on different geographic locations (US East, EU North, Asia Pacific North, etc).

Lighthouse Metrics

Grid.js: An Advanced Table Control ‚Äî A lightweight, advanced table plugin that can work alongside React, Angular, Vue, or, well, nothing. Check out some of the examples for more on how to use it. It uses Preact under the¬†hood.

Afshin Mehrabani

Uncut: An Open Source Typeface Catalogue, Focusing On Somewhat Contemporary Type ‚Äî Currently features about 50 fonts that are available for direct download, and it seems the fonts are all free or open¬†source.

uncut

WinBox: An HTML5 Window Manager for the Web ‚Äî Very thoroughly documented and works pretty well, but feels a bit like Web-based UI experiments of 10+ years ago..? GitHub¬†repo.

WinBox

Inkline: A Customizable Vue.js UI/UX Library ‚Äî Includes 50+ components designed for mobile-first apps with out-of-the-box accessibility support via¬†WAI-ARIA.

Alex Grozav

stylelint: A 'Mighty' Modern Style Linter ‚Äî A linter with over 170 built-in rules to help ‚Äúcatch errors, apply limits and enforce stylistic conventions‚Äù. GitHub¬†repo.

stylelint

Jobs

Senior Web Developer (Node/ReactJS) - Remote ‚Äî Millions get inspired and plan adventures with our apps. To help us make komoot.com the place to go to plan outdoor adventures, we‚Äôre looking for a one of a kind Web Developer to join our¬†team.
Komoot

Find Frontend Jobs from 13K+ Remote Companies on Arc ‚Äî Close those tabs! Arc aggregates all remote F/E developer jobs. Get hired by companies like Spotify &¬†HubSpot.
Arc.dev

items.content:
Frontend Focus

#‚Äã487 ‚Äî April 21, 2021 | Read on the web

An In-Depth Guide To Measuring Core Web Vitals ‚Äî How are Core Web Vitals measured? How do you know your fixes have had the desired effect and when will you see the results in Google Search Console? Barry Pollard takes a¬†look. Jess B Peck's The Almost-Complete Guide to Cumulative Layout Shift is another useful guide digging deeper into one¬†aspect.

Smashing Magazine

Introducing CSS Grid Inspector in Safari ‚Äî Safari now has a CSS Grid Layout Inspector (you can try it as of Safari Technology Preview 123), this post looks at how to use¬†it.

Razvan Caliman (WebKit)

Live Webinar: Building Editor X‚Äôs Award-Winning Homepage ‚Äî Discover best practices for building a homepage. Go behind the scenes of the award-winning new Editor X homepage and explore the process from concept to build. Join design & marketing experts for a webinar about creating a powerful homepage. Save your spot¬†now‚á¢

Editor X sponsor

'CSS is a Strongly Typed Language' ‚Äî ‚ÄúAs strongly-typed JavaScript becomes more popular, it is my hope that it helps developers become more comfortable with the firm, yet flexible approach of¬†CSS‚Äù. Head to the comments for the expected 'CSS isn't a programming language' debate¬†;-)

Eric Bailey

Resolving Overflow Issues in CSS ‚Äî Explores the causes of overflow issues and how to solve them, and looks at how modern features in the developer tools can make the process of fixing and debugging¬†easier.

Ahmad Shadeed

‚ö°Ô∏è Quick bits:

  • Version 88 of Firefox arrived earlier this week, with a few small CSS fixes and disabling FTP support.
  • Here's a look at what's new in DevTools in Chrome 91.
  • The W3C has launched a new Web Machine Learning Working Group.
  • The Canary version of Microsoft Edge now has a performance mode to improve RAM, CPU, and battery usage.
  • Both QUIC and HTTP/3 support is now in Firefox Nightly and Beta.
  • The Tailwind UI component library now has React and Vue support.
  • Ever wondered just how often people actually copy and paste things from Stack Overflow?
  • We often link to Josh Comeau, and this time he's written up an in-depth look at the tech stack behind his blog.

üìô Tutorials, Articles & Opinion

Best Practices for Cookie Notices ‚Äî A look at how cookie notices can affect performance, performance measurement, and UX, along with advice on how to optimise their overall¬†usability.

Katie Hempenius

Slow and Steady: Converting Sentry‚Äôs Entire Frontend to TypeScript ‚Äî Dozens of developers took a year to convert 1,100 files and 95,000 lines of code from JavaScript to TypeScript. This is one of those ‚Äúwe did a complicated thing and here‚Äôs what we learnt‚Äù pieces you‚Äôll want to point to if your workplace attempts a similar¬†thing.

Priscila Oliveira and Mark Story (Sentry)

Floating an Element to the Bottom Corner ‚Äî Pushing an element to the right or the left is easy enough with the float property, but here‚Äôs a CSS-only solution to position something to the bottom of an¬†element.

Temani Afif

State of Internal Tools Report 2021 ‚Äî We surveyed 650 developers on how and why they build internal front ends. Find out the most popular¬†tools.

Retool sponsor

A Real World CSS vs. CSS-in-JS Performance Comparison ‚Äî No huge surprise here, I¬†suspect.

Tomas Pustelnik

The Best Approach to Lazy Load Images for Maximum Performance
Adrian Bece

Debugging JavaScript Efficiently with Chrome DevTools
Victoria Lo

Going ‚ÄúMeta GSAP‚Äù: The Quest for ‚ÄúPerfect‚Äù Infinite Scrolling
Jhey Tompkins

üßê¬†FLoC Off?

Earlier this year Google shared an update on their planned replacement for third-party cookies ‚Äî¬†however it's fair to say this proposal for a 'Federated Learning of Cohorts' (or FLoC for short) hasn't gone down well, with backlash from Mozilla, Brave, DuckDuckGo, and others. It's looking like Google may be going it alone on this one.

  • If you're looking for a primer on all of this Dieter Bohn has a solid write-up of what it all means.
  • WordPress may treat Google's FloC as a security issue ‚Äî¬†a proposal has been raised in WordPress Core to block the identifier by default.
  • Bennett Cyphers writing at EFF describes FLoC as "the opposite of privacy-preserving technology".
  • Chromium browser Brave has removed FLoC, calling it 'harmful to web users'.
  • DuckDuckGo have released a Chrome extension to block FloC's tracking.
  • The Verge have a thorough report on the current stance of Vivaldi, Mozilla and Microsoft's Edge. This from Ars Technica is also worth a look.
  • Here's a tweet from John Wilander of the WebKit team on the matter.
  • Finally, here's how you can opt your site out of Google's FLoC network (by altering HTTP response headers).

üîß Code, Tools and Resources

Style Check: Audit The Effect of Different CSS Sources on Plain HTML Elements ‚Äî Shows you a comprehensive set of HTML elements to which you can apply a selected library (Bootstrap, Normalize, etc) or import one via URL to see how the elements¬†behave.

Austin Gil

Font Brief: Discover Fonts Based on Font Attributes ‚Äî Search a curated collection of paid and free fonts using specific font qualities like elegance, friendliness, classic, and so¬†forth.

kore

Soft UI Dashboard: A Free Bootstrap 5 Dashboard ‚Äî Includes individual page components you can view here or check out the full¬†demo.

Creative Tim

Alternative Tweet Embeds: Embed Tweets Without Compromising Your Users' Privacy and Your Site's Performance

Stefan Bohacek

Sergey: A Tiny Static Site Generator ‚Äî A no-configuration SSG that will render your HTML, include partials, and render out slots. The sort of thing you'd use if even Eleventy is too much.

Trys Mudford
